item.title: Report X-2024090637
item.description:
Report X-2024090637

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-12T09:14:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-03
  • City: ROUND ROCK
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: CONTENTS OF ONE IGLOO COOLER WRAPPED IN PLASTIC GOING TO CANADA WAS INSPECTED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE IGLOO COOLER, THERE IS APPROXIMATELY TEN POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING NON-REGULATED LOCTITE AA 334 MAGNET BONDER. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER IGLOO COOLER TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS SHIPPING AIR TO CANADA. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During a scheduled delivery there was what was thought to be vapors escaping from the nitrogen PRV on the cargo tank that was observed by customer personnel during the unloading. Unloading was stopped, problem diagnosed and unload completed without further incident. No liquid spilled, no further emergency response required.

item.title: Report X-2024090339
item.description:
Report X-2024090339

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-10T09:23:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-25
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=703554083498 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1845 CLASS=90 QTY UOM=Solid - Kilogram PSN TEXT=Dry Ice PKG GRP=N/A SPILLED QTY=0.0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=22.7 CONTAINER UOM=Solid - Kilogram MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=D - Fiberboard or cardboard NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=3 - Box TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=22.7 TOTAL UOM=Solid - Kilogram )The shipment was discovered leaking on an inbound flight. UN 1866 (5 Steel/Metal Drums) and UN1845,(in Styrofoam) Overpacked in a Corrugated Box. UN 1866 Resin Solution leaked from 1- Steel/Metal Can (Closed Head) that was dented on the side. The Dry Ice, UN 1845 did not escape the outer packaging. The shipment was held for shipper dispostion, then picked up by the customer.

item.title: Report E-2024090107
item.description:
Report E-2024090107

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-10T09:23:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-07
  • City: AUSTIN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7600
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering diesel fuel into the customer's storage tank. During the course of the delivery, the connection between the delivery hose and storage tank became compromised. This allowed approximately 20 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. Lone Star Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report X-2024090246
item.description:
Report X-2024090246

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-04
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Aaron Gutierrez Supervisor called safety to report a spill in trailer 552059, UN1139, COATING SOLUTION, 3, PG II. Aaron stated when the crew opened the doors to the trailer is when the leaking 5 gallon pail was found. Aaron stated it looks to be 12oz of the coating solution spilled on the pallet and the trailer floor. Aaron stated the bottom of the pail looks to have been damaged by the pallet it is setting on. Aaron stated he shut the trailer doors and called the spill into safety.

  • City: DALLAS

item.title: Report E-2024090100
item.description:
Report E-2024090100

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-26
  • City: GRAND PRAIRIE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 26, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of ink had a loosened seal and released approximately 0.9 gallon of product to the exterior of the drum. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel inspected the drum and proceeded to tighten the valves. Once crews were sure the freight was secured and no further cargo leak would occur, they staged the drum for further shipment and processing. No waste was generated during this cleanup.

item.title: Report E-2024090077
item.description:
Report E-2024090077

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-14
  • City: SHERMAN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal LSH experienced a UN3266 SK-250 release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-ounces of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the drum lid/body only due to a pallet nail puncture. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090087
item.description:
Report E-2024090087

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-13
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal LDA experienced a UN1824 Ecolab Aquanomic 2.0 Low Temp Laundry Builder release from a 30-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of product released to a 4' x 2' area of the trailer floor and a 5' x 10' area of the concrete lot below. It was suspected the drum was punctured by a pallet nail. Kolor-Safe neutralizer and absorbents were deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents were then collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged drum of product was placed into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: It was reported that approximately 10-gallons of Printing Ink White were released from two 55-gallon DM due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted the concrete at dock door 118. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site.
